title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationCQRS - Q0001
text: What does CQRS stand for in microservices architecture?
explanation: CQRS stands for Command Query Responsibility Segregation, a pattern that separates read and write operations.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationCQRS - Q0002
text: What is the main goal of the CQRS pattern?

options.text: To separate read and write responsibilities for scalability and performance
To synchronize all services in real time
To reduce the number of microservices

explanation: CQRS separates read and write responsibilities to improve scalability, performance, and maintainability.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationCQRS - Q0003
text: In CQRS, what does the Command side handle?
explanation: The Command side handles write operations that modify the systemâ€™s state.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationCQRS - Q0004
text: In CQRS, what does the Query side handle?
explanation: The Query side handles read operations that retrieve data from the system.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationCQRS - Q0005
text: Which of the following is a key benefit of CQRS?

options.text: Improved scalability and performance for reads and writes

explanation: CQRS improves scalability and performance by allowing independent optimization of read and write operations.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationCQRS - Q0006
text: Which of the following is a common challenge in implementing CQRS?

options.text: Maintaining eventual consistency between read and write models

explanation: Maintaining eventual consistency between the read and write models is a common challenge in CQRS.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationCQRS - Q0007
text: Which of the following patterns is often used with CQRS?
explanation: Event Sourcing is often used with CQRS to maintain a history of state changes and synchronize read models.

title: MicroservicesServiceCollaborationCQRS - Q0008
text: What type of consistency does CQRS typically provide?
explanation: CQRS typically provides eventual consistency between the command and query sides.

text: Which of the following is a benefit of CQRS for scalability?
